forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 5pm. Partly sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 3 to 13 mph. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 5am, then a chance of drizzle. Mostly cloudy. Low around 53, with temperatures rising to around 55 overnight. West southwest wind 10 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco this morning, a gentle veil of clouds lingers over the city, hinting at the shifts to come. The air holds a mildness, whispering of the rain expected to arrive as the day matures. Currently, there’s a mix of sunlight and cloud cover—a delicate interplay of clarity and obscure hues. As the sun struggles against the encroaching clouds, it casts a soft glow over the streets, with temperatures hovering comfortably around the mid-sixties before gradually retreating.

As the hours slip by, the forecast predicts rain will unfurl its curtain after 5 PM, so consider carrying an umbrella on your afternoon stroll. The haze may limit long-distance views across the bay, but your local cafes beckon warmly, perfect for indulging in a delicious pastry while watching the world meander by. With the potential for drizzle tonight, layer up lightly, perhaps with a light jacket to shield against the evening chill as the temperature cools to the low fifties. Let the rhythm of this day guide you toward cozy conversations and moments of quiet reflection, all under the shifting skies of this splendid city.
